subject: Re: [junit] catch failure to take screenshot with selenium
msgSnippet: Hello David, ... Yes, I saw it. I agree that it seems a better way to go. For example, throwing always the error on the catch block is smart. What I did is
messageBody:
Hello David,

On 08/30/2010 07:07 AM, David Saff wrote:
> That's very similar to what I would have done. By the way, did you
> look at TestWatchman in the JUnit code? It might be even closer to
> what you want as a starting point. Thanks,

Yes, I saw it.
I agree that it seems a better way to go. For example, throwing always
the error on the catch block is smart.

What I did is almost a TestWatchman, but instead of starting and
finished I used after and before.

So I'll better use the TestWatchman instead of my hack.

Thanks a lot for your kind answers.
pura vida.
